name: Department of Homeland Security
description: DHS is responsible for public security, including border security, immigration enforcement, cybersecurity, disaster prevention and management, and counter-terrorism.

painPoints.point: Border surveillance technology modernization and detection system upgrades
Cybersecurity for critical infrastructure protection gaps
Immigration system IT modernization delays affecting processing capacity
Biometric identification system integration and interoperability challenges
Emergency response coordination and preparedness system improvements
Supply chain security and port of entry modernization
Workforce capacity in cybersecurity and IT modernization

Federal disaster assistance delivery challenges due to increasing frequency and intensity of natural disasters, with 27 disasters in 2024 causing at least $1 billion in damages each, straining federal resources and requiring more efficient relief efforts
painPoints.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - Improving the Delivery of Federal Disaster Assistance

painPoints.point: IT acquisition and management challenges including project delays, budget overruns, and need for improved oversight and mature acquisition practices affecting government-wide IT investments
painPoints.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - Improving IT Acquisitions and Management

strategicPriorities.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - Improving the Delivery of Federal Disaster Assistance

prefers: DHS EAGLE II and FirstSource holders

insights: DHS uses EAGLE II and FirstSource contract vehicles extensively
Border security technology modernization is ongoing multi-billion dollar priority
Cybersecurity for critical infrastructure is growing focus area
Emergency response contracts are frequently issued on short notice
Biometric identification systems are high-priority technology area
Strong preference for small businesses in IT and professional services
